Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the CDC's alleged mistake, stating that they reduced Florida's count by 79,000 cases when there was no such adjustment.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the CDC has been counting Pneumonia & Flu as COVID-19, dropping the number of cases from 90,000 to 11,000.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the CDC has dismissed the claims made by DeAnna Lorraine and has not made any adjustment to Florida's case count.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the change in hospital reporting procedures, ordered by the Trump administration, has led to drastic over-counting of Florida's case numbers, which is not supported by evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the rise in COVID-19 cases in Florida, such as community spread and increased testing.
